review.itemreviewed: MTL Long Sky 2 Matryx Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love the Long Sky. This is my third pair. There is now padding in the heal cup that gives me blisters. Really disappointed in this change.
review.name: Heal Cup Pads

review.itemreviewed: MTL Long Sky 2 Matryx Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was hoping to get something with excellent grip and perform great on most all terrain and be comfortable. These are perfect for that. Ran a 50k in them and would be comfortable up to 50 miles I’d imagine. Not super cushioned but I personally don’t like a big stack on technical trail running shoes. I’d rather feel the ground better than cushion and not roll an ankle. Only thing is feel like wearing a gaiter will help keep out debris. Depending on what trails your running of course.
review.name: Light, wide, and grippy

review.itemreviewed: MTL Long Sky 2 Matryx Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These have become my favorite shoe! I didn't think it could get better than the Peak 5 but then these hit and I am hooked.
review.name: Top shoe on the market!

review.itemreviewed: MTL Long Sky 2 Matryx Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Loving these, my first pair of Merrells, will purchase more.
review.name: perfect fit

review.itemreviewed: MTL Long Sky 2 Matryx Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Shoes are attractive - perfect with pants, and fit is spot on.
review.name: Casual and comfortable
comment: Thank you for your review.

review.itemreviewed: MTL Long Sky 2 Matryx Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Seem super durable. I have extremely wide foot and usually blow out shoes near arch.  So far not a problem.
review.name: Durable for wide feet
comment: Thank you for sharing your review.

review.itemreviewed: MTL Long Sky 2 Matryx Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very supportive and comfortable, especially in the heat. After one wear, the reinforced toe cover has caused slight wrinkling and worn the colour off the top in four small spots. No structural issue, but noticed early.
review.name: Very good

review.itemreviewed: MTL Long Sky 2 Matryx Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I wanted to love these shoes because the look, feel, responsiveness, ground protection, and durability are amazing. The ride is great without being too firm or too padded. And they have a minimal toe rocker, which is a fresh breath of air in a market where it seems like every other brand has excessive toe rockers. It's like running with a snug mountain cleat. They perform amazing even on rugged, rocky PA Apalachian Trail sections

However, they rub my arch just below the ball of the big toe. I can only run in these for a max of 10mi before I start to notice the beginning of blisters on my arch and my toes start to feel jammed together. And it's because the toe box is too narrow. Please Merrell, please, make these shoes with a natural foot shape and they would be the best shoe on the market. This shoe blended with the foot shape from a brand like Altra or Topo would be perfect.
review.name: Great Shoe, But Too Narrow of a Toe Box

review.itemreviewed: MTL Long Sky 2 Matryx Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
After over 350km in the shoe, it is a great shoe with one major fault.

Outsole - The best all-mountain sole I've ever had - gripped while smearing on rocks in Chamonix as well as in total mud. I can compare it to Inov-8's Graphene (TF270), Salomon S/lab (Sense, Pulsar, Genesis) and many others.

Midsole - A bit firm but I prefer it over more squishy foams like Salomon Genesis. Please, don't make any changes there. I've done multiple days of ~40km in mountains and the protection is adequate.

Upper - great thin Matryx upper with good drainage, it is holding fine so far. I'd slightly reduce the volume overall, mostly in the front part of midfoot (slight buckling of the upper at the end of laces). But the hold is good enough especially thanks to the traditional laces - please don't move to any quicklace-like system. And now comes the big problem -  a lot of derbis falls into the shoe around the heel collar. This causes blisters in the heels. I'm wondering if other reviewers have really problem with the fit or if the blisters are due to the derbis. It makes the shoe borderline unusable because I don't really want to stop just to dump the derbis. This issue is both with small stones (Chamonix) or with needles and other forest derbis (lower Chamonix, Stubai, Czechia).

Please don't change anything on the shoe except the heel collar (or just make the fit a bit more performance oriented with better foothold). If Skyfires didn't have the same solution of heel collar, I'd buy them as racing option for shorter races.
review.name: Great shoe, but derbis is falling in -> NO GOOD

review.itemreviewed: MTL Long Sky 2 Matryx Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Light, responsive, and tactile. So happy with these shoes!
review.name: Fast and fancy

name: MTL Long Sky 2 Matryx Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: At the end of the day i love the product when it is working.  The service people on the phone are great, but they can't do their job if the company does not keep replacement parts in stock.  Really there is no reason except a management decision to avoid the cost of having replacement parts in stock.  My system has been down for two months already.  I ordered another whole system just to get the red power module that i needed to get my system up and running because they did not have one to send me as a replacement for the one that malfunctioned. Also, i kept getting asked if I could see the green light on this module, i would have if they didn't place a bar code right over the light.  I finally figured out where the green light was and ripped the sticker off.
review.name: Great when working

review.reviewBody: Only issue is the power source requires a cigarette lighter which GM no longer offers in their pickups.
review.name: Outward Bound

review.reviewBody: I bought this a month ago. Was nervous that it would not work. At my cabin I found 1 bar 5g. This booster gave me 2 bars of 5g.  I have 1bar where originally i had no signal at all. Easy to set up.  I did buy the magnet outside antenna for ease until i can rig the bigger antenna. If you are on the fence- do it! It surprised me. Im going to put the antenna on a pole to reach higher to see if i can get 3 bars.
review.name: It works!

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my Tacoma after Hurricane Helene crippled the cell service in WNC. It was one of the simplest installs I’ve done. Clear instructions, intuitive design and quality components. Highly recommend this product. It amplifies any signal no matter how weak. It doesn’t create a signal from nothing.  So keep your expectations fair. I have my phone on a Ram Mount on the dash and was able to mount the internal antenna right behind the phone. Works great. If you switch the unit on and your phone bars don’t change, put your phone into “airplane mode” for a few seconds and then turn off airplane mode. This will trick your phone into acquiring the internal antenna and boom… more bars. Really like this product.
review.name: A solution in the storm

review.reviewBody: I have been using another brand in my previous camper vans and I just changed to Thule and it's way easier to install and easy to operate
review.name: Easy to install and looks awesome!!!

review.reviewBody: Just got this installed on our sprinter van. It needed a special bracket we didn’t know about ahead of time so that delayed us while we waited and the awning was lost in shipping for a couple of weeks. It is a really nice awning though.
review.name: Nice looking awning

review.reviewBody: I purchased the Thule Hideaway to replace my aging Fiamma. So glad I did. The quality is better than the Fiamma
review.name: Love my new hideaway!

review.reviewBody:
East to install on sprinter
Well built
Great product
review.name: Great awning

review.reviewBody: The product is working very well. I needed some tech support. They responded in a timely manner but didn't offer much in the way of assistance. In other words, I had a unique installation and they didn't offer much help in getting my issue resolved.
review.name: System works well.

review.reviewBody: Great product - easy to install.  Mounted on my 144 wb Mercedes Sprinter.  10.7 fits perfect from side slider to rear of vehicle - huge coverage and very easy to operate.
review.name: Thule HideAway

review.reviewBody: I would give 5 stars but they should include mounting brackets for the price point. Was a pain in the butt to have to order the brackets after the fact
review.name: Seems good

review.reviewBody: The awning itself is great. Does everything advertised. I needed a very simple mounting option and found that the adapters for mounting offered by Thule are very limiting. I only needed a horizontal bolt to mount to my roof rack to an existing flange(6 points) and they have nothing. Customer service, although attentive, pointed me right back to their available retail adapters on the website. I have had to purchase these and then modify everything to make it work.
review.name: Great Awning but needs better mounting options

name: Roof Mount HideAway Awning

review.reviewBody: I just came back from rafting 18 days in the Grand Canyon. This splash jacket was water tight & warm for the 50 degree water. I bought a men’s small because they don’t make one similar for ladies. My husband stretched the neck gasket over his boots & helped me put on & off the sleeves. The neoprene is a bit too tight. Otherwise, this was a super jacket. I’m 5’5” & 115 lbs.
review.name: No splash and stayed warm

name: Orion Paddling Jacket

description: Buy the Adventure Ready Brands Wash Capsule online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Wash Capsule
hasVariant.description: Buy the Adventure Ready Brands Wash Capsule online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Got this to use on camping trips/hikes. Really small canister and pretty light. You store these little flakes of soap on one side and the towels on the other. The towels are compressed and when you use the wetness from your hands it starts to unfold. It's pretty big and very easily dried my hands off and the towel was still not that wet. We used it to wipe out our little jet boil stove after cleaning up. It's pretty durable. Overall really happy with how much the soap lathered up and dry my hands were. Going to always have this on me when I hike or camp without hookup.
review.name: Small light and kept me clean

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Ready-to-clean capsules offer durability, portability, and versatility, adapting to various cleaning needs. Their weather-resistant design ensures reliability in different conditions, while ample storage capacity keeps supplies organized. This combination makes them efficient and convenient for effective cleaning on the go.
review.name: Advantages of ready to clean capsule

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love how compact this product is! The soap gets sudsy and the towels are nice size. I love that everything I need is right in the storage container. I bring it everywhere because I have 4 kids! It’s so helpful at the beach to wash hands before we eat!
review.name: Compact and easy to use

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This set of soap flakes and little towelettes is pretty cool and definitely will come in handy for lots of things because I have messy kids. Perfect to throw in the diaper bag and know I can have my kids sanitize their hands with more then just hand sanitizer after things like the petting zoo and playing at the park after a rainy day. 
Comes with a super convenient metal holding tube. The little triangle flakes are perfect for clean hands in a snap or with just a bit of water. The little cloths come super compact and fluf and unfold real nice with a bit of water. 
I received this as a gift for my review and so happy I did, I found a permanent staple to my diaper bag or glove box for my car. Would definitely buy and recommend.
review.name: Clean hands anywhere with a bit of water.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are super convenient to travel with. I had been looking to buy something like this for a while so I was excited to finally give it a try. Works great and leaves a clean, fresh feeling.
review.name: Works great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Adventure Ready Clean Capsule is an amazing product that you must try. These biodegradable soap flakes dissolve easily in your hands, providing a convenient and eco-friendly way to stay clean. The compact and stylish container is perfect for camping, travel, or any on-the-go situation. Simply grab a flake, add some water, rub your hands together, and towel dry with the included compressed towelettes. It's a game-changer for anyone who values convenience and cleanliness!
review.name: Adventure Ready Clean Capsule

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really liked this product. Was genuinely easy to use, cleaned pretty well and was easy to keep in my bag to take on trips. The tabs take a bit to dissolve but nothing crazy
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love how compact and easy to use this product is! I used it on a recent hiking trip and it was a great option to wash hands on the go. The soap flakes are biodegradable, which is great for the environment too
review.name: Easy to bring and useful tool!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a travel kit for outdoors.  It's a metal cylinder that holds soap flakes and condensed paper towels.  It is space saving, but you'll still need water to activate.  The size was ideal, and would take up less space than traveling with individual items.
review.name: Travel kit ideal for outdoors

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Out in the forest and you have no way to wash your hands this bit isbgreat and feeling fresh inbtge woods. It's compact and simple to use, which makes great sanitizing
review.name: Wash wash

name: Wash Capsule

review.reviewBody:
These did not fit well for my Trek Road bike (maybe it's not meant for oversized tubes)?

I managed to use about half the pieces to cover my downtube, but the thing strips and rectangular piece didn't seem to naturally cover any useful parts of the bike (for example they definitely don't cover any fraction of the fork). I also couldn't find any diagrams or drawings of how you're supposed to install these extra pieces online, and the videos on the company website didn't really shed any light. Another gripe is that the chevron shapes have a progressively decreasing sizes, so if you use all of them to cover the downtube (which I needed), the ones at the ends don't fully cover the sides.

The quality of the plastic seemed good, and the clear(ish) ones let the frame color show through and are not too visible. Overall I wouldn't buy these again though because of the size issues.
review.name: too small and weird shapes?

name: Honeycomb Frame Guard XL

review.reviewBody: My mom got me this for Christmas! I’m 140 lbs and 5’5. The minute I pulled it up my thighs the top seam ripped. I didn’t pull it hard at all. I am really disappointed in the quality. Not worth your money.

comment: We're very sorry to learn of the quality issues you are experiencing with your leggings. Our team will be reaching out to you via email to address your concerns.

review.reviewBody: Bought a medium tall for my 6' 130lb daughter who normally wears a medium (4/6) and she could barely get them past her knees. They look like a kids size. They fit my 9yr old niece better so I gave them to her. Very disappointed.

review.reviewBody: Very narrow in the larger sizes (10,11,12,13) at D width… which is strange because the weekender width is fine. How the heck does the standard width vary across shoes? Standard width should be a static measurement
review.name: Too narrow at larger sizes
comment: Thank you for your review. Our boots are handcrafted and made on different lasts, which shift the volume of the boot and depending on the size, the width will vary as well. We will pass your comments along to the proper channels to see if more consistency can be found in the widths.

review.reviewBody: Ordered my usual size 13 in Briar. I have a narrow foot (B width) and after inserting a cork bottom SOLE insert they fit pretty good with a little heel slippage. Would not want to wear these without an insert as the insole is flat and hard. These are thick, stiff old school leather boots that do require some break-in which I'm still working on.  So far so good and they look great.
review.name: good looking boot
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that your boots are working well for you, minus the rough break in period. Thanks for the tips and tricks about the break-in! We hope to continue to serve you in the future!

review.reviewBody: Once broken in very comfy. Well made, you get what you pay for.
review.name: Chukka
comment: Thank you for this great review! We're glad you love them!

review.reviewBody: Thought I had buyers remorse for a while but then Bam..broke in beautifully. Let me know when the copper becomes available in 10.5. Will buy that one too.
review.name: Fantastic!
comment: This is such a sweet review! I am so glad they ended up perfect for you!

review.reviewBody: I purchased this chukka a few times to try different sizes and widths. Obviously I picked the size that fit. I’m just over two weeks in and my left heel still gets sore like the shoes aren’t broken in. This never happened with my blacksmiths. The difference in construction between the left and the right is noticeable in a couple ways. I can tie the left shoe easily with plenty of shoe lace to use but the right shoe doesn’t give the same amount of room. This is a wide size and the left shoe is definitely roomier than the right which may explain this lacing issue. It just feels weird having one shoe fit so different than the other and I am used to enjoying Red Wings but I’m not sure about these. Hopefully the issue will resolve itself in time.
review.name: Not what I’m used to getting from Red Wing
comment: Thank you for your review! We are sorry to hear your boots are not performing as expected. We will reach out to you directly to do what we can to assist via email.

review.reviewBody: I have 2 pair of these.  One Sunday got to meeting pair another for everything else.  Had the old pair about 15 years.  I recommend these highly.  Had them resoled and this made the old pair look vintage! Buy this boot!
review.name: Great boot
comment: We appreciate your loyalty and support over the years!

review.reviewBody: I spend a lot of time on my feet at work, with weather warming up this are the perfect pair of boots. Comfortable out of the box and short break in period compared to my other red wings I own. Only downfall is I feel the laces are a bit short, but those can easily be replaced! Another successful purchase in my book.
review.name: Love them!
comment: Thank you for your review!  We're happy to hear your boots are comfortable and can pass along the lace suggestion to the appropriate team.

review.reviewBody: These have held up well after a year of daily abuse.  The soles could probably use a replace and I have a couple stitches that need attention, but I'm confident if I take care of these, I'll have them for life.  Break in was a nightmare for me personally, but once I broke em, they are as comfy as slippers.  Nice bonus, I get lots of compliments on them.
review.name: Best work boots I've ever owned.  Made in the US.
comment: SanDiegoDude, Thank you for leaving this great review. We are happy to hear you are satisfied with our product. If anything comes about in the future, please let us know.

review.reviewBody: Have had for 2+ months and have been wearing 6 days a week. Very stylish and comfortable and fit just right.
review.name: Style and Comfort
comment: Thank you for this kind review! We hope we continue to be apart of your day to day.

review.reviewBody: Bought these beautiful boots a month ago and like all the redwings I’ve bought I have no regrets always satisfied with redwings these are very comfortable and the Leather looks great conditions very well easy to put on and take off before break in wouldn’t change anything about it
review.name: High quality
comment: Thank you so much for this wonderful review! We love to hear from happy customers.

name: Chukka Boot - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Cheyanne Metro II WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: One winter and its gone. Cant believe its Sorel witch I wearing for many many years
review.name: Quality
comment: Hello Igor, we want to extend our apologies concerning your experience. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

review.itemreviewed: Cheyanne Metro II WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Absolutely fantastic boots. Very impressed with quality, comfort, warmth and durability.
review.name: Top quality and lovely style.

review.itemreviewed: Cheyanne Metro II WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Had to return my husband shoes, the 11.5 was small for him.  He really liked the color and style.
review.name: Return was easy
comment: Hello Georgina, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our Men's SOREL Metro™ II Boot is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Cheyanne Metro II WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I purchased these boots and they felt great, nice, and wide.  However, when I put them on the 2nd time (1st being at the store), my left boot was instantly soaked inside.   
It is a shame that we have to pay out of our pocket to have a new set of boots shipped to their company when it is a defective boot. 
Love the style, love the comfort, but not in love with the warranty process.  
I actually bought another pair because I didn't want to go through the hassle of returning the product, but guess what?  The second pair leaked too!  Same left boot!  You will get your product back and I hope you can fix them.
review.name: Waterproof??? Nope.
comment: Hello Lou13, we want to extend our sincerest apologies concerning this issue. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

name: Cheyanne Metro II WP Boot - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Super Soft 7/8 Colour Theory Legging - Women's
review.reviewBody: Too sheer - see right through these.  Also, I am not a fan of the no-seem look… it’s like an anatomically incorrect plastic doll.
review.name: Not for me

review.itemreviewed: Super Soft 7/8 Colour Theory Legging - Women's
review.reviewBody: Brilliant quality. Excellent fit. Colour is amazing.
review.name: Thrilled with my purchase. Highly recommend it.

review.itemreviewed: Super Soft 7/8 Colour Theory Legging - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these. Extremely soft and great for any workout. I did have to size up as my usual size felt a bit snug. Would recommend if you can get them on stock 😃
review.name: Great!

review.itemreviewed: Super Soft 7/8 Colour Theory Legging - Women's
review.reviewBody: I now have these in green, yellow and pink (I already have orange, red and cornflower blue leggings, so couldn't justify buying those colours). They fit like they were tailor made for me, high waist, no camel toe and the pocket is handy for teaching yoga. I wish these were made in more colours and became a standard legging. I'd build a collection!
review.name: The best

review.itemreviewed: Super Soft 7/8 Colour Theory Legging - Women's
review.reviewBody: Fab! Perfect fit. I am short, the 7/8 are superb. Both leggings I purchased fit like a glove. Far superior to any other brand I have tried!
review.name: Leggings

review.itemreviewed: Super Soft 7/8 Colour Theory Legging - Women's
review.reviewBody: Please make this in black and all the basic colours ! Fitting and everything is amazing. Best part is it is seamless at the front part 😝
review.name: Best leggings ever

review.itemreviewed: Super Soft 7/8 Colour Theory Legging - Women's
review.reviewBody: Buttery soft, I sweat a lot and haven't had unsightly wet patches showing yet! Then again, I wouldn't use these for high impact activities like running, but hot yoga is A-OK. I'm a size L and found them to be slightly snug, but comfortable.
review.name: Soft and sweet!

review.itemreviewed: Super Soft 7/8 Colour Theory Legging - Women's
review.reviewBody:
These leggings are a beautiful colour, I opted for the peaceful green. They also stay in place whilst working through different asanas. Great garment!

#TeamSweatyBetty
review.name: The ultimate Yoga leggings

review.itemreviewed: Super Soft 7/8 Colour Theory Legging - Women's
review.reviewBody: Got these leggings and matching sweatshirt. Great outfit but the leggings were inches smaller in the waist than my Al day leggings in a small. Therefore had to return to store and was told that they did not have said colour. Very disappointed . Will not deal with online as the customer service is non existent. No human contact available and email takes 3 days to reply.If however you can complete total order I would be very grateful. I look forward to hearing from you.
review.name: Sizing wrong
comment:
Hi there,

A massive thank you for taking time out of your day to leave us feedback.

We’re so sorry to hear that our Super Soft 7/8 Leggings Colour Theory didn’t fit as you’d hoped. We’re listening, learning and constantly striving to be better. We will make sure to pass this onto the relevant team.

Should you require any further assistance, our Customer Care Team would be more than happy to help.

Best wishes,
Team SB

name: Super Soft 7/8 Colour Theory Legging - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Design, Color and Fit was great right out of package. First chance to use it this past Tue; tour in Paris. 17,500 steps++, it’s warm here in Paris; sweat trapped inside pants. Fabric not breathable - very unfortunate. We sat to rest, after 10mins then upon getting up - fabric was sticking to skin. Terrible feel. 15K steps later; stitches in crotch area causing terrible friction - chafing to my inner thighs. Causing me to modify my walking pattern. Very awkward feel on our way home after tour 😞 Sorry, I can’t recommend this product. 

Belt is cool. Fabric is stretchy allowing squatting and bending easy.
review.name: Not what I was expecting

review.reviewBody: I picked up a pair of these in hopes that I could start buying these instead of Pranas, which I think this is meant to be an answer to. It is definitely cheaper, but it feels cheaper, and the design isn't as good. I like the color, and I like that it has an integrated belt like the Prana Zion, but the belt has a clip fastener and is not as easy to adjust as that one. Fit is true to size. The pockets are serviceable but don't have the Zion's cover over the back right pocket. (They aren't an exact match for the Zion, or the Brion, so they are kind of doing their own thing.) It's less money, but is it *enough* less money to buy it over the competition? Boy, I don't know about that.
review.name: Decent, but you get what you pay for

name: Utility Venture Pant - Men's

description: Buy the Burley D'Lite X Stroller online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: D'Lite X Stroller
hasVariant.description: Buy the Burley D'Lite X Stroller online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Fantastic product. My granddaughter loves it!
review.name: Granddaughter loves it!

review.reviewBody: Gives me more freedom. I can get a ride in and take the baby with me. Easy to use and the baby likes being out.
review.name: Great Riding Stroller

review.reviewBody: This was a gift for my grandson and his parents are looking forward to many adventures with him!
review.name: This was a gift for

review.reviewBody: I have bought this model because of the passenger comfort reviews and the head rest included. I was evaluating and testing Thule Cross but bought Burley online as there was no test facility in my area. I regret. It is so hot inside. The side windows are not vented at all. Why not use a net like Thule? Wish I could tested it before the purchase.
review.name: Plastic windows instead of net

review.reviewBody: This trailer rides smooth enough that my 1 year old grandson fell asleep riding on a rough gravel/ dirt trail, awesome trailer
review.name: Great trailer

review.reviewBody: I really love this. It’s very sturdy and the simplicity of all the components is very well thought out I like how most things are pre-attached and nothing can get lost. Overall, I think that this design is much better than the other brand name that is a bit more expensive than this. I can tell that my little bicycle cart is going to last me a lifetime. My son loves to go and sit in it when it’s parked in the garage it’s perfect. Thanks, Burley for making such a great product.
review.name: My kids love it

review.reviewBody: Recently purchased a new D’Lite X single. I just moved to Chicago from Eugene, OR, so a Thule was not an option. I was planning on buying a used bike trailer, so that I might take my 16 m.o. granddaughter for rides along Lake Shore Drive’s famous bike path. I couldn’t find a reasonably priced used one in Eugene or Chicagoland, as people don’t want to sell them or they repurpose them. Although on that first trip my granddaughter was initially unhappy about a bike helmet, she spent the next hour in rapt awe as we made our way through the fascinating cacophony that is Chicago bike paths on the weekend. (So different from the rural hills and Willamette River pathways of Eugene.) I was very pleased with the suspension system — this will be very helpful when we venture into the pot-hole filled streets of the town. I like the idea of using recycled material, although like with Patagonia, the reality is a hard one to prove. I was reluctant to spend what seems to be an inordinate amount of money, but the quality of the seat alone made the deal. Having watched the price of baby seats go through the roof [sic], Burley could reasonably charge even more. Attaching the steel hitch to an older Trek Madone was trivial; a newer Trek Checkpoint did require a longer skewer, but determining the size was straightforward. I was very surprised how little I noticed pulling the trailer with either bike; as my granddaughter grows, that may change. When it does, it’ll be time for a ride-along, with the D’Lite transitioning to a travel trailer. With 4 panniers, a handlebar and rear rack bag, the 75+ pounds the trailer could carry means that a full solar array, a microwave, two fly fishing rigs, and a Stellarvue refractor can come along on the bike packing trip. [Just kidding.] I have a garage, so storage is not a real problem. Collapsing the trailer for transport looks reasonable. [Unfortunately, this review was NOT sponsored by a promotion. If Burley would like to send me a corporate swag kit, I may have to accept. 🙄]
review.name: You get what you pay for . . .

review.reviewBody: I love how easy this converts to a stroller after a bike ride. The extra elbow roOk and removable foot mat is fantastic. The UV protection on the windows is another big favorite and I love the open mesh in the back window to allow more air flow. This rides so so smooth. My only issue is I’m not a fan of the middle bar as it cuts cargo space down a lot and the recline isn’t as reclined as Thule is. I would not put a baby under 6 months in this, because even in the deepest recline it’s very upright. Please make an actually reclined baby hammock like Thule so we can use the stroller function earlier!
review.name: Worth it

review.reviewBody: The Burley D'Lite X (single) is the prefect blend of comfort features, space and ease of use. Tons of space for the essentials plus all the extras. Loaded with clever features to take the annoyances out of trailers that competitors have. We are so happy with our Burely D'Lite X (single). I have recommended it to all of our friends and family.
review.name: The D'Lite X is D'trailer to have

review.reviewBody: My kids love the burley d’lite x. As a bike trailer and a stroller. It checks all our boxes. It was built with kids in mind. My 1 year old can sleep in the recliner position while my 4 year old sits up and enjoys the ride.
review.name: Kid minded trailer

name: D'Lite X Stroller

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I think that the spoon part of the spork works perfectly, and I have no issues with it. The fork part on the other hand isn’t my favorite. I feel like the spikes on it need to be more pointy instead of rounded because I found it hard to prick up my food with it. Also, I think there needs to be more of the fork part incorporated into it.
review.name: Not the best use for a fork

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect spork. Easy use as a spoon or a fork. Very strong. Easy to clean. Just overall, a very good spork for everyday use or for a nice camping trip.
review.name: Easy use as either a spoon or fork.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Metal fork, very lightweight and small. Which is useful for camping. Easy to clean, stainless steel. This summer will try out when I’ll go to camping .
review.name: Steel fork

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this spork from Influenster to try in return for my honest review. First impression it is made very well,will be great for camping trips. Lightweight, durable. Easy to clean. I will have to purchase other products from their line as we do a lot of primative camping, and these would be a great additon to our supplies.
review.name: Durable, lightweight

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Who doesn’t love a good spork. Love the kind of material it’s made out of. Easy to transport and very light. It’s durable and good to use in any setting.
review.name: Great spork!

name: Frontier UL Spork

review.reviewBody: It’s well made and warm. Only issues are that the neon yellow I got is semi transparent so you can see the layer underneath, and it runs a bit large. According to the size guide I got a large, but it’s baggy and long, should have gotten the medium. I’m 5’11” with a 42” chest.
review.name: Great value

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'7 and 132 Lbs wearing size small. It's true size and excellent protection from cold. Very comfortable as well. With Merino wool base layer, and just this jersey is no problem with 48 degrees in Chicago springs.
review.name: Can't go wrong with this brand

review.reviewBody: So I received the thermal Jersey , it looks nice and the material is great BUT , the fitting is not good .. I normally wear large and this fits okey on my arms and chest area BUT at the waistline it’s big , seems like this jersey is design for people with big bellies , so if you’re expecting a racefit don’t buy this . I’ll gift this to someone ..
review.name: Fits weird

review.reviewBody: I bought a medium; I'm 5'11 with a 41° chest. Fits perfectly, not too tight but not loose, and goes well with the matching thermal bib. Overall no complaints - works well under 50 degrees F.
review.name: Fits Well

review.reviewBody: PI's Quest Thermal Jersey is a great cool weather jersey.  Fit is great, and the jersey is nice and warm.  The inside is lined with a really soft fleece lining of some sort.  Works very well to keep you insulated.  Depending on temps and conditions I'll wear this by itself - with a barrier jacket on top of it - or it under an AmFIB jacket (Interval or Quest).  LOTS of great options to dial in your cold weather comfort.  New colors for Fall '20 are sharp -- with Navy/Solar Flare (Orange) being my favorite.  Even tho the Quest line is PI's low-end line, don't consider these low-end products.  They are definitely very well made and perform great, at a great price!
review.name: Great Thermal Jersey!

review.reviewBody: I ordered this jersey as a layer under my jacket for winter riding.  I like the thermal lining which seems to add the warmth I need while still remaining agile and light weight.  However, the sizing is really messed up as the body of the size medium barely touches the top of my bike shorts, while the sleeves are the right length.  I always wear a medium in jerseys and other tops, but this one is all out of whack in its proportions.  I'll return it and try a large if it's available.
review.name: Nice jersey but too small

review.reviewBody: No complaints...
review.name: Great product
comment: what size did you bought/

review.reviewBody: Great jersey for riding in temps around 50 degrees.   Nice long arms for tall guys.
review.name: Quality Jersey

name: Quest Thermal Jersey - Men's

review.reviewBody: Looks neat in the picture, but looks can be deceiving. I have crimps for love handles, and this pattern makes me look short and stout, like a brick. If you don't mind that, you probably will mind that putting on the shirt is like pulling your head through a wet suit. Am returning.
review.name: Comfortable Material, Head hole too smal

When I measured my hand the size chart showed a much larger size than I’ve ever worn.  So I went with a medium.  Because of the individual fingers inside the glove, you need the extra room and I am kicking myself for not getting the large.

review.reviewBody:
Chamois is a little fluffier than Specialized chamois's, but still very firm compared to Assos. The density is very comparable to Castelli. The shape of the chamois is excellent: it protects the goods and avoids any chafing. 

Sizing is definitely on the euro/small side. I have a 35" waist but I went with the XL instead of the L, and I'm glad I did, cause even the XL feels a bit tight.

These shorts have a really classy look to them because they have a really flattering straight seam down the front of the legs and the back of the legs. You can't really see it in the picture, but in real life it looks really nice.

(I submitted this review on my wife's account. I am very much a large man.)
review.name: Classy & Comfortable Short

name: Chrono Short - Men's

description: Buy the Gregory Rhune 20L Pack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Rhune 20L Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Rhune 20L Pack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Perfect with one exception, the front zipper has no ability to be secured. This might be a pickpockets delight for the inattentive.

Absolutely love this pack. This is my fourth Gregory pack and they have all been great at meeting my specific needs. I’m a pilot and I ordered this pack to use as my flight bag. The inside compartments are perfect for storing my headset, iPad, charts, etc.  the bag is comfortable and very well made. I couldn’t be happier with this purchase.
review.name: Perfect pack for my needs

review.reviewBody: Sleek and sturdy with easy access to all the pockets
review.name: Everyday bag

review.reviewBody: I have finally found the PERFECT DAY PACK!! I carry a leather journal, calendar/journal, tool pack, iPhones, iPhone accessories, and pen pack. Everything fits in the Gregory Rhune 20 perfectly!
review.name: Finally - the PERFECT day pack!

review.reviewBody: Perfect do-it-all pack. Works great for the office or international travel.
review.name: A Very Versatile Pack!

review.reviewBody: Bought this for travel but haven't taken the trip yet so this is just an "unboxing" review.  Quality of the pack, shoulder straps and zippers is outstanding.  Exterior fabric appears to be very durable.  This is my first Gregory and I am very impressed with the workmanship.  I got it on sale and it is an excellent value compared to other similarly sized packs.  This pack fits a size niche for me between a 16 L Arc Teryx Mantis 16 and an Osprey expandable 26+6 L.  I can't comment on functionality of the pocket arrangement since I've not taken my trip yet.
review.name: First Gregory and I'm Impressed

review.reviewBody: My husband just used this backpack for 2 weeks in Japan.  It was perfect for the plane and for walking around everyday.  It's really great quality with useful pockets and organizers.  He loved everything about it and it looked great on him.
review.name: Looks great with great features

review.reviewBody: I love this bag. It has a great look and is so well made. Gregory does not short on quality. Love the many compartments for all my gear. The bag holds so much without looking too bulky on my back. It’s my new EDC.
review.name: Great quality bag.

review.reviewBody: I'm sort of a backpack, bag, luggage geek and over many years have purchased way too many (so my wife says). I do consider myself to be a very experienced backpack user/reviewer. I am also a pro photographer and often use backpacks (with cubes) as opposed to camera backpacks internationally. I stumbled onto this pack at a local shop and was very impressed. It is a great all rounder and so very well designed for convenience and durability.  I find the 20L size to be not too big, not too small as an EDC or even for a day hike or city jaunt.  It excels in perfection mainly for the smart design. I honestly can't think of one thing to change or add...that's rare for me as a backpack collector. There was nary a thread or miss sewn anything, excellent craftsmanship!  I ended up choosing the brick red for a touch of fashionista...I don't  feel we need to always have black, gray or navy to be cool or incognito.  I also prefer having a laptop space inside the main compartment as opposed to a separate area in back. Overall I'm very pleased with this bag and it will be one of my special bags in my collection. Pretty much a go to for EDC. Well done Gregory!
review.name: Well Designed With Superb Materials & Craftsmanshi

review.reviewBody:
Overall, great pack for everyday use and the perfect size (20L) for commuting to/from the office. It holds a 15" laptop snuggly. It does not stand upright on it's own. Items inside the pack have to arranged for perfect weight distribution for it to stand up right - in reality, no one is going to take the time to rearrange contents every time an item is added. It's doesn't have the most comfortable shoulder harness system - it's padded, but a little stiff/rigid out of the box - hopefully it breaks in and softens with a more use. Because it lacks strap keepers, there are A LOT of dangling straps. I find this annoying, so I trimmed about 8" off each strap, melted the ends, and re-sewed the ends into loops (just like the factory ends). It looks much cleaner without so many dangling straps. As long as you melt the ends re-sewing the loops isn't totally necessary (but it is good insurance against raveling).

A few changes would make this pack near perfect:
- Add microfiber lining to the top quick access pocket for better protection against scratching items like sunglasses.
- Add strap keepers to clean up dangling straps.
- Make the bottom flatter and more rigid so it will stand upright on it's own.
review.name: Great Everyday Commuter Pack

name: Rhune 20L Pack

review.reviewBody:
*I’m reviewing the Rootbeer Snow Angel boots*
So these boots are NOT the color displayed. The color displayed is a darker brown; which my wife has a pair of grey so she wanted the darker brown. Let me be as clear as possible, THESE SHOES ARE SAND BROWN AT MOST! They are very light brown! Do not buy these if you think they are dark brown. This company needs to adjust their products because this is very misleading. And for the price you’re paying, you want to make sure you’re getting what is advertised! Overall they get 3 star because I got lucky and my wife actually liked the color, but be warned.
review.name: 3 star because my wife likes them
comment: Hello, we want to extend our apologies concerning your experience. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my wife for Lapland trip. Ordered exact size. Perfect fit, dry, warm in -15 degrees
review.name: Fantastic Cold Weather Boot

review.reviewBody: This will be my second pair purchasing these boots. My first lasted nine years. They will last! I still have the first  pair but they are looking rough (but still comfy) they have been moved to dog walk boots. Totally worth the money. I love SOREL!
review.name: Perfect winter boot

review.reviewBody: These boots are just what I needed.  I wanted something shorter than my snow boots and muck boots, something that was waterproof, and easy to slip into and out of so when I need to take a quick trip outside to check livestock.  They also work great for taking my dog out.  They keep my feet warm and dry!  Love them.  I ordered a bit bigger than I usually wear so I could wear thick socks with them.  They are just a little big with my heavier socks, but that's better than being too tight.
review.name: Awesome waterproof boots!

review.reviewBody: I got new Sorel Snow Angel boots, and love the weight. I have been dragging Caribous around for years, and am pleased with the more comfortable weight.  The new boots are shorter and, living in the country, I use gaiters to make up for the lack of height. These boots  are so comfortable, I have a not-narrow foot and they felt good right off the bat.
review.name: Shorter snow boots

review.reviewBody: I just ordered my second pair of Sorels, can't wait to get them as I wore out the old ones that lasted 13 years! They had red plaid on the top and were sooooooo cute but I couldn't find any like that now. I wear them every day in the winter and love your boots!
review.name: Fantastic boots for around farm animals etc as well as everyday

review.reviewBody: Exactly what I was looking for! I feel confident that I will not slip on snowy ground.
review.name: Warm and comfortable!

review.reviewBody: I love these boots! My feet are always cold, even in higher quality boots. I've wanted to go hiking more, but I just can't stand the cold feet. After some research, I read that these were good and decided to try them. They are amazing and my feet actually feel warm in the snow!
review.name: These boots are actually warm!

review.reviewBody: So comfortable! Bought them visiting Colorado! Perfect for hiking and my feet stayed warm the whole time!
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody:
Wish with all my heart I could give this boot a better rating. Have worn your boots for many years… the quality isn’t what it was when boots were first made in Portland, Oregon. 

Wish you would offer a special collection made in USA (Portland, Oregon) … Real fur trim.  Wool liners. Top grade pliable leather.  Yes, the cost would be high …but fit, function and lasting quality are worth the price.
review.name:
Creat a Special Collection- 
Made in Portland, Oregon.

review.reviewBody:
I've found these to walk really well, with less friction that my previous 2018 Maestrale RS--plus the one-lever walk mode makes transitions super easy. Heel hold is solid but they're certainly made for medium to wide feet so folks with narrow feet/heels may want to consult a bootfitter prior to purchase. 

Performance on the downhill is exactly what you'd expect from a burly touring boot. The stiffness feels as advertised and progression through the flex is smooth. So far they've been a dream driving my powder skis through cascade concrete and icy groomers alike.

If I had to nitpick, the liners are missing laces which could become a problem on longer tours, although so far it hasn't been an issue.
review.name: Walk as good as they skis

review.reviewBody: This boot is very comfortable in the wlk mode or while going uphill skinning.  When it goes in the ski mode it provide plenty pf stiffness and control.
review.name: Wide last helps my 6th toe.

review.reviewBody: 15 days in it’s awesome, very versatile if it fits its your jam. Used on the hill and backcountry.
review.name: Super comfy

review.reviewBody: Comfort and performance
if it fits your foot, this will be the greatest touring boot you'll ever use.

This boot is awesome. It fit pretty good out of the box but with a little work for my bunion buddy it fits great. Very comfortable for longish days. They are a little heavy for the longest and furthest days, but with a true 120 flex they feel stiff and I feel confident in them. I am considering getting rid of my in bounds alpine boots and only having these and a pair of lighter boots for bigger tours. Hoji walk transitions like a dream. Overall love the boot but I'll probably replace the liners next season as they are a little thin for my liking.
review.name: Comfy after some work, love Hoji walk

review.reviewBody: The combination of tech in this boot between the lock system and the flex not usually seen in a AT boot makes it best in class!
review.name: Amazing boot!

review.reviewBody: These boots are about the closest I've found to perfection. I have short, wide 27.5 mondo feet. Despite their 103.5mm last I still had to give these things a mild punch on my bunion, but that's where the complaints end. They ski like a true 125 flex (maybe just a smidgen softer than my 130 hawx primes), and are significantly lighter with a far superior walk mode. I can confidently drive my car around a crowded lot with these things unstrapped. Also worlds easier and less painful to get into and out of if you have a high instep. The Hoji switch is the real deal for quick touring/skiing transitions. I love how the ankle ratchet strap really locks your heel into place. This is primarily a touring boot, not an inbounds Alpine boot, but it's still capable of driving my 188cm/110mm j skis in heavy PNW "powder". In form resort conditions their light weight definitely gets a little skittish, but that's not really their purpose anyway. Overall, the best, most well thought out touring boot for wide feet I've ever stepped into.
review.name: Top notch touring boot!

review.reviewBody: The boots are incredibly lightweight and still stiff enough to ski the most challenging terrain.   Also, I have a normal foot shape and they fit right out of the box.
review.name: Perfect Fit

review.reviewBody:
So happy with these new boots.
Very comfy and excellent performance for downhill
review.name: Awesone

name: Radical Pro Alpine Touring Boot - 2025

review.itemreviewed: Mountain 600 Full Grain Leather Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I couldn’t be happier with this purchase! I live in Arkansas and I hike on the weekends. This boot exceeds expectations. Not only did I get them cheaper on any other site but the shipping was soooo fast! They are definitely TTS. I am between a 6 1/2 and 7 and the 7 fit perfectly. For thicker socks I would have been ok going up another half size. The vibram sole is like walking on air. This pair comes with red and brown laces (which is nice to change up) Backcountry is by far the best outdoor company to purchase from. If you are on the fence.. Go for it!
review.name: Best purchase EVER!

review.itemreviewed: Mountain 600 Full Grain Leather Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
These boots are by far the best I’ve ever worn or owned! And I’ve had several. Let me tell you about them… 
They keep my feet dry, and warm. Whether it be from rain or snow. They are stylish enough that I can wear them out and about if I choose. I did purchase the Danner red laces just cuz I love that look. If I could wear these all the time I would. They give me enough ankle support and yet I don’t feel restricted in any way. I love these so much so that I’ve been looking EVERYWHERE for them in black but they’re sold out. I will keep looking!!
review.name: Love

review.itemreviewed: Mountain 600 Full Grain Leather Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have tried probably 15 different pairs and brand of hiking boots and these are the absolute best pair. Enough room to have thin or thick socks on. I've never gotten blisters and I've hiked many miles in these. Extremely durable and great ankle support. I went up half a size just to have a little more space for when my feet swell from hiking. Danner all the way!
review.name: Best hiking boot!

name: Mountain 600 Full Grain Leather Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I wanted a wearable sleeping bag… I was expecting it to be wearable, but not literally sleepable. Its both! So does that mean it’s super long? Yes. However, you can pull the bottom up to your waist, cinch it, and let the excess fall down. On me, it came down to my lower calves that way. But if I needed to sleep in it- it was def kind enough to cover my feet. I wore it whilst walking my kids around on a cold Halloween also with sprinkling rain. The rain dripped off of me and with a hoodie underneath I was plenty warm. Best part is the pockets! Also has a hood… absolutely worth the purchase.
review.name: Double the function

name: Dreamwalker Wearable Sleeping Bag

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of Patagonia Dirt Craft shorts with liners.  Super comfortable, great liner, and excellent fit, except for the length.  This is the second pair that I've taken to a local tailor to hem the length by 1.5-2 inches because they're long AF.  It's no fun spending extra money altering nice gear after you've bought it, but I still love the Patagonia shorts.
review.name: Great shorts, except for the length

review.reviewBody: Wore them for a weekend trip to a dh bike park. Fit and feel were fantastic and even wearing them on the drive there and back felt like regular shorts. Would buy again even at this price point for how much I liked them.
review.name: Fantastic

name: Dirt Craft Bike Short - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Powder Lite II Hooded Jacket - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Such nice and warm jacket for my little one! He loves it and will actually leave the hood on since it’s so comfortable! It is not super bulky but super warm since it is insulated!! Your toddler needs this!
review.name: Must have for your toddler!

review.itemreviewed: Powder Lite II Hooded Jacket - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: Bought it for my nephew and it so cute and perfect for the cold.
review.name: Perfect gift.

review.itemreviewed: Powder Lite II Hooded Jacket - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Buying for the second time, love this jacket for its warmth and design. For NYC in winter the weight is perfect. I like that the inside is not fuzzy, so it slides on easily over a t shirt and sweatshirt, no tugging needed. The hood is great for times when we forget a hat. And I like that the pockets do not have zippers, because they’re always available for cold hands and no chance of scratching his skin on the zipper. This year I got true size 3T which is perfect for 3.5 year old boy. Previously bought 2T when he was 1.5 and it fit for 2 winters. It was our daily
Jacket for preschool. I washed that jacket 3 times when it got too much food/dirt on it (a little dish soap on the greasy areas) and everything washed out perfectly and looked brand new.
review.name: Perfect preschool jacket for NYC

review.itemreviewed: Powder Lite II Hooded Jacket - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality, our eldest had a pair and it kept him warm.
review.name: Great Quality to last a lifetime

review.itemreviewed: Powder Lite II Hooded Jacket - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very nice and warm and light weight size true to size would recommend the jacket
review.name: Toddler jacket

review.itemreviewed: Powder Lite II Hooded Jacket - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: Good for mild winters and fall. Fits great on my son and worked well all winter
review.name: Toddler coat

review.itemreviewed: Powder Lite II Hooded Jacket - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Looking for a non bulky jacket for a toddler. This jacket is perfect. The style quality and fit is just great.
review.name: Fit style. Great for toddler as it’s not bulky

review.itemreviewed: Powder Lite II Hooded Jacket - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great jacket, not bulky but super warm!  Great for our cold winters to be playing outside and still feeling like the little one can move around and play.
review.name: Warmth without the bulk

name: Powder Lite II Hooded Jacket - Toddler Boys'

description: Buy the Thule Compass Kayak Carrier online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Compass Kayak Carrier
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Compass Kayak Carrier online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: We have used this rack for 2 trips.  It does not lock, but is east to remove from the crossbar to be stowed inside the vehicle while we were camping.  The rack is compact so that we were ae to carry a kayak and a canoe on our trips.  After a 5 hour car ride, the vessels were still secure and stable.  Excellent product.
review.name: Simple and strong

review.reviewBody: Nice quality, this mounted perfectly on Toyota OEM crossbars as the bracket is about 4" wide. I suggest putting the straps on the rack 1 kayak at a time and start with loading the side of the vehicle with the rack farthest away (if not centered) as it is easy to get them tangled and bunched over each other. Also, if you have an SUV you will be hopeless putting on 2 kayaks by yourself if you are under 6' tall. I bought my rack second hand (used once) from a shorter person with a big SUV.
review.name: Like it!

review.reviewBody: We have used the Thule Compass many times and we love it. The only issue is that it does take a while to load and secure boats. Not a huge deal and should get better with practice.
review.name: Awesome product!

review.reviewBody: Works AWESOME with our two kayaks! Super smooth to install and mount kayaks! Yipppeee Thule!
review.name: Two Kayaks AWESOMENESS

review.reviewBody: If your car/SUV is high, as ours is, coupled with the wide beam of our kayaks, then the height of our kayak reached 10 feet (3 meters). We found this unmanageable so returned item (very easy through Thule). This could work for a lower roofed car and a less beamy kayak.
review.name: Could work in theory
comment:
I'm sorry to hear that the Thule Compass did not work for your family's uses!
I hope that you are able to find a different Thule kayak carrier that meets your needs. I recommend looking at a rear-loading kayak carrier, like the Thule DockGlide, or the lift-assist Thule Hullavator Pro, both of which make loading a boat to a taller vehicle much easier!

review.reviewBody: The Thule Compass is the best dual kayak mount we've owned!  It was worth every penny!  Our kayaks are extremely secure during transport.  It's a very durable products and matches perfectly with our Thule Xsporter Pro Low truck rack.  The straps are also durable and when used properly secure our kayaks like nobody's business!  We couldn't be happier.  Now if someone just made a truck bed cover to fit with the Xsporter Pro Low truck rack, I'd be 100% in business!
review.name: 2 Kayaks = 5* for this mount

review.reviewBody: Easy install, great instructions, works as advertised. Very happy with it.
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: Bought the EVO crossbars and double kayak carrier for our smaller travel car. We are empty nester so prefer not to be driving our SUV when not required. Have a number of other Thule products, ski box and bike carrier. They are built right and last. Wonderful to buy quality products that buck the ‘planned obsolescence’ trend.
review.name: Thule products always impress.

review.reviewBody: I’ve had this rack for about a year and have used it on numerous occasions hauling 1-2 10ft kayaks. Only issue is that both plastic wing nuts/knobs have popped off. One within a month of purchasing and the other after 7months of use. We now bring a wrench with us to tighten and loosen. Apart from that, it's been a great kayak rack.
review.name: Solid rack, faulty wing knobs

review.reviewBody: I bought this about a month ago. I have been using it to haul around two kayaks. It is a solidly build system that gives me absolutely no worries about whether it will work. It’s an example of you get what you pay for - in this case - great quality and a great product.
review.name: Great quality

name: Compass Kayak Carrier

review.reviewBody: Arrived with broken zipper and final sale. Never again will purchase from this company!
review.name: piece of crap

review.reviewBody: I love this fleece, and so does everyone else! I can't even count how many compliments I've received. I bought the fleece in pink and it's so fun. It is also super warm! I'm about 5'10 and bought a medium. It fits relatively loosely and comfortably but I love my fleeces and sweatshirts to be super oversized so I maybe would've gone with a large but I don't regret keeping the medium, it's still great.
review.name: SO warm!

review.reviewBody: This jacket looked so cozy but it’s not cozy while wearing unfortunately. There’s no sherpa on the inside. It is oversized (I got XS and am 5’6, 120ish lbs). I love the color combination but had to return since I was looking for something a bit warmer and more comfortable.
review.name: Wanted to love this

review.reviewBody:
Very large
No zip pockets as the description stated
Main zipper dud not work
I had to call Backcountry more than 1x since they originally charged me return shipping.
They did adjust the $$
review.name: Returned jacket

review.reviewBody: Bought this to wear hiking with my dog in hunting season which does the job for that—it’s bright and warm in mild cold weather, and ok over a big sweater. It is however much frumpier in person than in the picture—I feel like a big clown wearing it in public.
review.name: Ok fleece

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket and want it in all the other colors. The pockets don’t have zippers but that’s ok. Order your standard size and it will be a pretty oversized fit! That’s what I wanted so I am very happy.
review.name: I wear this everyday

review.reviewBody: Worn a few times. Great for dog walking and trips around town.
review.name: Really cute and comfy

description: Buy the Gregory Deva 60L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Deva 60L Backpack - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Deva 60L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I had such high hopes for this bag. The compartments are awesome. Obviously the build quality is superior because Gregory is the best. However, the hip belt on this bag is so uncomfortable. I've gone on a couple of backpacking trips with it and I can never get the hip belt just right, which is no good when you're packing 30+lbs. Also the pockets on the hip belt are basically useless with how small they are. I wish I had bought a different bag.
review.name: Uncomfortable

review.reviewBody: Once I got the right size and fit, this pack suited me well for a 3 night trip. The sidekick is an important feature so I can set up camp and still hike with less to carry. Sturdy, just the right number and size of pockets, and top or front load all serve me well.
review.name: Great features

review.reviewBody: This pack had multiple different pockets and features that are well thought out. The included day pack made a trip to the Grand Canyon much easier as you could leave the full pack behind for lighter weight.
review.name: Great pack making hiking/camping easy

review.reviewBody:
Used this pack so far for a 5 day backpacking trip. Was able to fit a bear can in it along with all my stuff for a 5 day trip through the Sierras. I loved all the pockets - it helped keep everything organized. Overall, it was comfortable. 

My biggest issue with it though is that the waistband is too big for me and it doesn't come in a smaller size. I got the Small. I have a 17" torso, 25" waist, 33" hips and I could not get the waist straps to tighten enough. I ended up having to take the buckle off to give me 3 more inches to tighten it down, and then I also had to use foam padding my friend had to increase bulk, making it a huge pain to take the pack on/off, and even then it was too big.

Overall, I think it would be a good backpacking pack for a 2-7 day trip. I just wish the waist belt came in smaller sizes. If you are petite, I would suggest another brand.
review.name: Good backpacking pack

review.reviewBody: I love everything about this pack with the exception of the hip belt. Every trip left me with large bruises on my hips until I created some additional padding and added it to the existing belt.
an excellent all-around hauler for weekend and week-long trips alike
review.name: Deva 60 - Women - Gregory

review.reviewBody: When deciding to upgrade my backpacking set up, I mulled over which rucksack to get for months. I consulted all my buddies in the industry and read every review and always came back to the Deva. What a solid choice it was! I've now had this pack through a summer season in central Idaho and a winter season while I study outdoor education in Norway. This pack has already been through hell and back but it's structural integrity and every piece of it still looks pristine. Gregory did phenomenal with the pocket set up, access points, and tiny details (the sunglasses holder is my absolute favorite). My only gripe with it is the bottom section (separated by a removable divider) barely fits my Kelty synthetic sleeping bag. It makes me worry I'll break the zipper and wish I opted for a down bag. Nonetheless, it deserves the awards it got!
review.name: Solid from Idaho to Norway!

review.reviewBody: Gregory makes great packs to begin with, and the Deva stays in that tradition. It's been used on multiple over night and several night stay trips. Holds enough for one person for a couple days and has enough space to carried a part of kiddos gear when we've gone on family trips. My wife loves this pack and I would highly recommend it because of her experience with it.
review.name: Awesome pack

review.reviewBody: Wish it was a little larger or had a few more spots to hook carabiners to the outside. Overall, I love that the front fully opens. It has a good number of pockets to stash different items and stay organized. It fits my body perfectly. Moves with me.
Perfect fit for my 5’2” frame. Very comfortable on long hikes and love all the extra pockets and attachments and it comes with a small detachable mesh backpack.
review.name: Favorite Pack

name: Deva 60L Backpack - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Dyora RS S9 Bib Short - Women's
review.reviewBody: Assos makes the best bibs. Last forever when cared for properly.
review.name: Great bibs!

review.itemreviewed: Dyora RS S9 Bib Short - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very tight straps, but nailed the material, but easy to get off, with a nice feel. Love handle area was all messed up. Hits at the wrong spot, like it wasn't originally designed for women's hips, but no underwear line. Legs had a great material, but not supper grippy. Chaomis: 7/10. Average width in the butt area, and on the more padded side. I returned it because of my longer torso, and the weird midsection.
review.name: complete review

review.itemreviewed: Dyora RS S9 Bib Short - Women's
review.reviewBody:
So expensive bibs are worth it, who would have thought! 
I should have gotten a pair of nice bibs a long time ago. What a difference!
I'd anything changes I'll post an update.
They do run small though, when I opened them up and looked at them I wasn't sure they were going to fit but they fit great!
review.name: First ride in and wow!

review.itemreviewed: Dyora RS S9 Bib Short - Women's
review.reviewBody:
These run small. I'm built like Chris Froome but with implants at 5'10" and 135 lbs. I have a short torso and long legs. The small is compressive on me, but I like that, especially for long rides. If they made a "small tall" it would be perfect. I need a few more inches of thigh material, but my pant inseam is 34". The chamois took a long time to break in. It takes longer to dry, as it is dense. The dense chamois feels amazing on long rides, but only after I broke it in over the course of 10+ rides. These bibs feel like they'll be around my kit closet in 10 years, even with regular use. (Like the old Assos products. Newer tends to fit better, but last less time.) 
If you have larger breasts (c/d cup), these straps are AMAZING because they don't cross over the nipple area, compressing the chest. They stay to the side and in place during the ride. The bibs front panel is shorter, which takes some getting used to. This does make them more ideal on hotter rides, as there is less material covering the body under the jersey. 
Perfect for: hot temps (80+ degrees), 50-100 mile rides, 5'6" riders
review.name: Perfect for long rides

review.itemreviewed: Dyora RS S9 Bib Short - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I love the Assos T'Laalalai women's bib  shorts and have 2 pair.  I thought I would try these Dyora summer bibs as they are the latest design and I live in a hot, humid climate.  I thought they might be even better than the T'Laalalai.  My DH likes the men's and I researched and was aware the women's have a different strap style with the rear straps being looped and sewn in farther down the short, nearer the pad.  I was worried they would show under the jersey and look weird.  Turn out that doesn't happen or bother me but I hate the feel of the straps pulling down on my shoulders and compressing my spine.  I have worn them indoor, outdoors, short and long rides and I still do not like how they feel.  I don't have a great lumbar spine and they just feel like they compress my L-3-4-5 vertebrae at all times.  I am 5'2" & 110 lbs and got the small which is what I usually wear and they seem true to Assos size chart.  My torso is short as I take a less than 16" backpack size so it's not a long torso creating the feel but could be due to my spine not enjoying downward force on my vertebral  discs even when I'm aero, horizontal on the bike. 

I do not like the front styling, front panel looks weird is a bit short.  I also worry the straps creating these stretchy loops over your back and rear could get me pulled off the bike in a tight or tangled situation with another rider's handlebars, although it is unlikely, it worries me.   Why this weird butt loops, Assos's,  for women but not men?

The actual chamois and rear padding are fine.  The bibs are nicely compressive similar to T'Laalalai and the grey pad is nice.  I should have returned them but I tried so hard to like them and get used to them.  If you like the T'Laalalai, don't bother to get these, they are not an upgrade, at least not for my body.
review.name: Uncomfortable spine pressure weird strap

review.itemreviewed: Dyora RS S9 Bib Short - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are my second pair of Assos bibs.  I bought the T.LaalaLaiShorts_S7 Lady Bib Shorts - Women's a few months ago and they are incredibly comfortable but the over-the-head straps are a little odd so I thought I would try these.  These bibs seem to run a little smaller and the chamois feels thicker.  It's also been slower to break in (felt a bit like wet cardboard the other day).  Not sure what the difference in chamois is and these will likely be comfortable in time but I didn't have the same a-ha moment.
review.name: Think I prefer the T.Laala's

name: Dyora RS S9 Bib Short - Women's

review.reviewBody:
As soon as I put them on I could feel my toes being squeezed together.  This would be a problem walking around and hiking downhill, which is half the purpose of the shoe, so I returned them. The toe box is a standard width, i.e. narrow.  For comparison, the toe boxes of my Five Ten Freerider Pro shoes are wider and quite comfortable for me. I also like the toe boxes of Altra Lone Peaks and La Sportiva TX4s, but neither of these make a good biking shoe. 

The sizing runs small. Specialized recommended a 43.5 but a 44 would have been right, however I still think they'd be too narrow (size 43 Freerider Pros have a wider toe box than the 43.5 Rime Flats). 

If these fit your feet, the good news is they seem like they'd stick well to flat pedals, have decent tread, are flexible enough to be ok for hiking while at the same time have good stiffness for pedaling, and finally look well made.  

Overall, if these fit they'd be a good shoe for bike packing and touring.  If you need something wider, then I'd check out the Five Ten Freerider Pro which is very comparable in function.
review.name: Good for narrow feet

review.reviewBody:
The shoe is great.  A first I was apprehensive about the support which felt back towards the heal a little bit:  this is switching from running shoes which I wear mostly.

I almost returned these and then decided to wear them around the house a bit.

I still think the support back towards the heal does not fit well with the arch of my foot as I would expect, so for my feet it's something I would use specifically for trail rides:  If I had to hike 5 miles after a mechanical, I do not have an answer to that one yet.  The shoe keeps growing on me, so that's something.

These shoes are really sticky with my RaceFace Chester pedals.  These shoes have been a joy to use on the bike so far.

Did I mention they are sticky?

Update:  I really like these shoes and will probably buy them again. 5/5
review.name: It's good (Updated from 12/11/21)

review.reviewBody:
These felt very sturdy and seemed very well constructed.  I took them for a ride around my neighborhood and they stuck to my Shimano flat pedals like duct tape.
However, the toe-box was way, way too narrow. Based on reviews, I ordered a half-size bigger than normal. Once I received them I felt for my toes and the shoes were definitely about a half-size too big.  However, the toe-box was uncomfortably narrow.
Sadly (because I love all Specialized stuff), I returned them.
review.name: Sticky, solid, but tiny toe-box

review.reviewBody: Received these shoes next day, shipping was faster than ordering from specialized directly. I  had ordered them from specialized initially but because they ran one size small had to return. Once I got them these shoes gripped really well with the bontrager flat pedals I am running and I?m yet to test them on a hiking trip. Love the shoes so far.
review.name: Fantastic shoes
comment: What is your normal shoe size?  I am a 10 and am considering getting a 43.5, should I go up a half size?

name: Rime Flat Mountain Bike Shoe

review.reviewBody: Very disappointed with this shoe. Have had two pairs of Kjerags and wanted something similar with a bit more cushion. This is not it. The exposed stitching snagged on one of.my first runs but is somehow hanging on. The upper and lacking are a nightmare. I used for much of a 100mile training week and had to constantly adjust the lacing during runs, but never felt a secure lock for the upper. The heel is the worst part of this shoe. It sticks out for no apparent reason and I would catch it and twist my ankle on technical descents. I'm not sure what I will use this shoe for.
review.name: It Has Vibrant Soles

review.reviewBody: I love the goal of the company and founder Kilian to make shoes that are premium and last for a long time. The upper really didn’t work for me though. It felt like I was running in a bag. The fit was pretty off too. The size felt right but it’s a weird shape. Wanted to like them but I could tell as soon as I put them on that they were going to take way too long to get used to.
review.name: Not for my feet
