review.reviewBody: Bought a pair and they seem like they are very well made however they run small.  I am a standard 36 and these fit more like a 34.
review.name: Great shorts…run Small

review.reviewBody:
I actually didn't use these so the star rating can be disregarded, I have no idea how they perform, etc.  

Size up 1-2 sizes from what you wear in other brands if you have bigger thighs.  I am 5'10, 185 and have a 34" true waist, and measured 24" thigh circumference at the largest spot and typically buy a 32 in Fox, Zoic, Abit, etc and could barely squeeze the 33s over my thighs while the waist actually fit right.  I do own a lot of and wear tight road bibs but these style shorts are not comfortable when the outer short is too tight since they don't move like lycra.  The sizing almost reminds me of Castelli road bibs - +2 sizes for fat Americans :)

This is not a complaint, just hoping to help some others buy the right size!
review.name: Size up 1-2 sizes

review.reviewBody: I am keeping the shorts, but tossing the liners in the trash.  The shorts are comfortable, fit well and have good adjustments.  The liners are another story.  They don't have any grip material on the leg openings so they constantly ride up into your crotch when pedaling.  It's super uncomfortable and annoying.  I checked with Patagonia and for some reason they are designed this way.
review.name: Shorts are Fine, Liners are Worthless

review.reviewBody:
Ordered these based on recommendations from a friend.  Couldn't be happier with the quality of the product, the tech features like waist adjustment and zippered side leg gear (phone) pocket work great.  The liner is very high quality and the chamois is very comfortable.  The liners construction is very breathable and put it to the test for several consecutive days on the bike in hot muggy weather this weekend and VERY happy.

As many reviews have said definitely order a size (or even 2) up.  I wear a size 30 almost always but could barely get into the 30s.  I ordered a 31 and 32 and it was a tough call which one was best and I could have easily kept both.  I ended up using the 31 as I wanted to over shorts to be a little tighter as I use these on gravel bike as well as moutain.

Great product and would recommend to anyone.
review.name: Excellent pair of shorts- order size up

review.reviewBody: Great Shorts and liners. Quality you would expect from Patagonia. Left leg pocket is big enough for a large phone and is not bothersome.
review.name: Runs small, Still Love em

review.reviewBody: Normally 31-32 waist and just in case ordered 32 and 33... both were crazy tight! Order up 2 sizes and itll likely fit spot on, seem decent otherwise on quality
review.name: SUPER SMALL!

review.reviewBody:
Overall just too much $ for what you get. Buy something else. Outer shell good and light weight yet inner liner creeps up while riding. 

Definitely better than the ultra lightweight yet ultra poorly constructed Dirt Roamers ( do NOT get those.)  If you like to constantly tug on your inner liners while holding the handlebars, go for it. They have no thigh elastic and just ride up to your upper thigh all the time.  A far better solution would be to sell just the shell and allow riders to provide their own padded shorts, which are a dime a dozen.  if you do buy, size up in order to allow the waist to get tighter and looser. If you order your true size, there is no space to allow for the few winter lbs you might gain.   Patagonia mtb short collection is terrible.
review.name: Size up. Problematic liner. Skip em
comment: disagree. I have three pairs of these shorts and they are excellent.

review.reviewBody: Normally wear a 42. 5 which equates to 9. 5 US for climbing shoes. Couldn't fit my feet into the 9. 5's I just got delivered
review.name: Sizing is way off

review.reviewBody: I have a 13 street shoe size and ordered the same for these. I broke them in pretty quickly and they're tight-but-comfortable after just a few sessions. I had the normal Method shoes, but their toe box is weirdly high-volume for my feet. The Method S is more consistent and slimmer. I bought a second pair to have a spare.
review.name: Great fit and grip

review.reviewBody: Sleek, stylish and well designed with great performance fit. The heel cup and last maintains excellent toe capacity achievement.
review.name: Sleek

review.reviewBody: These shoes fit well. They feel streamlined and grip on the rock well
review.name: Method S

review.reviewBody: In the black diamond youtube channel, they have a video on these shoes, and the guy in the video says to size down a couple just like you would normal aggressive shoes. These were way too small and had to return. upon new arrival of a bigger size( my true size) they are still incredibly small and have started to fall apart and unpeel at all the plastic edges. Also the first time i bought they were on sale, the next time not. so i just payed extra money for not any better of a shoe. thanks. it’s a great shoe though!
review.name: Bad recommendation

review.reviewBody: They’re ok, but after one session my toe box was turning. I got them my street shoe size, and they feel pretty tight, but don’t edge well.
review.name: They’re ok

review.reviewBody: The Method S surprised me with how solid it is as an all around shoe that does well in all aspects of climbing. It can keep up with hard bouldering and sport, but is comfortable enough to wear for a long time at the gym or for sensitive slab climbs. It has many modern features that are becoming more common like a big toe patch, one velcro strap, and a 3D molded heel. I have pretty wide feet so there are some pressure points in the mid-foot and the heel felt a bit sloppy. I would also recommend going up a half size from your street shoe size unless you want a really sensitive and tight fit.
review.name: Jack of All Trades

review.reviewBody: Looks like BD has arrived at the top level with their climbing shoes! These feel like the love child of a Skwama and Solution with Moccasym dna mixed in. Been bouldering, sport climbing and even jamming a little in these. Solid edging and confident smearing. A little tough to put on, but cozy enough that you can leave them on. Holding up well so far. Size wise go bigger than you think. I'm a 38 Skwama and these fit perfect at 41.5. Right on BD. Keep up the good work.
review.name: A new contender

review.reviewBody:
I've been climbing for ~25 years and have been through an innumerable amount of shoes. The BD Method S is off to a good start save for a couple of key feedback points to consider.
1. In the photo you can see the "factory second" approach to the stitching on the left shoe's velcro closure tab. You might think, "no biggie" and yes but if you are trying to whole-foot toe hook this makes it feel like there is a marble on top of your foot. Not exactly great and an honestly poor attention to detail. For this alone I was pretty disappointed and thus the 4 of 5 stars, BUT there are several positives about the shoes also.
2. Sizing. I was shocked after a long chat discussion with the BD rep that they recommended to get the exact same size as my BD approach shoes. For a performance rock shoe fit I prefer it quite tight, as would most anyone looking to push their own limit. My performance rock shoes have always been 0.5-1.5 sizes smaller than my approach shoes depending on the brand. To buy the same size as my approach shoes left me feeling VERY dubious, but the rep was spot on correct. This may not hold true for other BD rock shoes, but it worked for the Method S.
3. The gluing in spots is a bit suspect and we will see how it holds up. This goes back to the attention to detail comment in #1.
4. The fit and comfort of the shoe is quite nice after you've climbed in them for only a few minutes. There is an interior bootie that is seamlessly integrated into the shoe that is very comfortable. Similar to Tenya's interior bootie, but more comfortable and requiring less effort to wiggle into the correct position every time you put the shoe on, the Method S's interior bootie slides on smoothly like a sock each time and fits immediately without the readjusting that the Tenya's demand.
Summary: The Method S fits great and performs immediately out of the box. I'll be curious and excited to see how they wear but so far I'm impressed with the rubber's stickiness. Just a bit more attention to the small production details would make this a 5-star shoe.
review.name: Impressive out of the box, but with some constructive criticism

review.reviewBody: Great shoes for sport climbing! Not as good for bouldering as the shadows especially since the upper foot pad doesn’t have nearly the same grip.
review.name: Great comfortable shoes

The Teca WB also stores in its own pocket, so it travels beautifully. Great jacket for transitional weather.

description: Buy the Saucony Triumph 22 Running Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Triumph 22 Running Shoe - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Saucony Triumph 22 Running Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Terrible fit. I’ve trained in Triumphs forever & before the Endorphins, ran marathons in them too. I loved this shoe but this redesign is awful. Shoe is too wide in the midfoot, doesn’t sit well in the arch & I can’t even tie the laces tight enough to get good support. This shoe fits like the Ride (which I tried & disliked) but has a lot more cushion. Also, the toe box is too generous, I have blisters from my foot sloshing around. It pains me to write this review. I bought every pair of 21’s I could find & finally had to get the 22’s. Will be looking for another shoe.
review.name: Redesign total fail.

review.reviewBody: PLUSH!  Excellent support and movement with this shoe.  Fits exceptionally well and supports my normally 6 mile runs per day. Cannot say enough about this shoe's ride!
review.name: Plush ride!
comment: Thanks for the awesome feedback Kim!

review.reviewBody: This design is ugly as ever! Seriously looks like you’re wearing white boats on your feet with how high the soles are. Terrible changes in the design as my feet are hurting each time I have used them. Saucony go back to the design of Triumph 21!
review.name: Awful design

review.reviewBody: I've had my Triumph 22 about a month.  I can't say enough about this shoe.  I have knee pain and these have helped immensely.  I recently found i have a torn meniscus and I'm still able to work out some wearing this shoe.  Thank you Terry Drake, shoe Rep for the recommendation.
review.name: Greatest Shoe I've Owned

review.reviewBody: These shoes hurt my feet horribly. I tried several times to run in them and give them a chance but they continually sent radiating pain through my feet if worn for longer than 20 minutes. Definitely don’t recommend.
review.name: Hurt my feet horribly

review.reviewBody: I’ve worn Triumphs for years but you changed the shoe and the heal is huge. No longer works for me. Now wear Hokas
review.name: Changed and no longer work for me

review.reviewBody: Revamp of the Triumph is a winner. More stack slightly wider base.
review.name: Great shoe!
comment: Thanks for sharing Jo!

review.reviewBody: My new favorite shoe for every day wear.  I was a Hoka Bondi 6 & 7 girl but they rip around my pinky toe and look and feel hideous.   So far these are fine but only time will tell.  These are equally as comfortable as the Bondi 6, very roomy if you wear custom full shoe orthotics, and super comfortable all around.  I like the simplicity of the style of the shoe, and the toned down colors, not crazy looking like so many out there.  So bottom line, if they hold up well and keep the nice colors (wine or burgundy & light Grey with Coral colors), I'd be very happy!
review.name: Super comfortable & room for custom orthotics

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes.  At the recommendation of a pedorthist, I just switched from New Balance 1080, and I’m very pleased. Super comfortable, without being too cushioned. Very responsive and supportive with lots of toe room.
review.name: Great alternative to New Balance 1080
comment: Thanks for the awesome 5-stars Pam!

review.reviewBody: I bought these for the first time and I’m very happy with them as they not only look great, but make my feet feel comfortable. Light on the feet, after 8-10 hrs on my feet they make a world of difference on my well being.
review.name: Cushioned comfortable feet
comment: Thank you for sharing your experience!

name: Triumph 22 Running Shoe - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Radical Pro Alpine Touring Boot - 2025 - Women's
review.reviewBody: Loved my Hojis, but these have a crummy heel pocket and allow for a lot of rise. The ankle buckle in the previous design was angled down and back to lock in the heel. In this version the ankle strap seems to far forward and cinches more down than back, allowing for a lot of heel rise and foot slippage.  Of note I also sized down a whole size from my Hojis that fit me so much better.
review.name: Crummy heel pocket

review.itemreviewed: Radical Pro Alpine Touring Boot - 2025 - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are great boots for in bounds and touring. They take a bit to break in and definitely caused some tears in the process. The flex in the walk mode is amazing but make sure to get them fitted!

review.itemreviewed: Radical Pro Alpine Touring Boot - 2025 - Women's
review.reviewBody: This boot is so comfortable and the Hoji locking system makes for a quick transition in the backcountry. I used to have foot pain while skiing and found that this boot fit my feet- locking in the heel while giving just enough space in the toe for my bunions. I use this with both tech and alpine bindings.
review.name: No foot pain

review.itemreviewed: Radical Pro Alpine Touring Boot - 2025 - Women's
review.reviewBody:
These are the most comfortable ski boots I have ever put on! I have wider calf’s and usually am unable to buckle my ski boots on the top one of two buckles, mostly I hook them, but can’t clip the back. This is the first pair of boots I’ve had that I’ve been able to buckle every buckle and have my legs not fall asleep! It’s a huge deal for me. 
The flex is insane, walking up and down stairs is a breeze. 

On top of being comfortable, and functional. Dynafit customer service was awesome, I had to make a size exchange and the return boots were lost in the mail. Dynafit worked with me and shipped out the size exchange anyway.

review.itemreviewed: Radical Pro Alpine Touring Boot - 2025 - Women's
review.reviewBody: This boot does it all for a “big boot” if you and even call it that given it’s still very light. It drives the ski in all conditions and the foot feels incredibly secure given the ankle strap. The Hoagie lever makes for a quick transition at the top and keeps your settings in place. The walk mode is awesome and makes long tours feel easy. Super confident inspiring when you are looking to ski hard. I find the fit to be very comfortable with no hot spots (probably first time ever) and the colors are rad. Love this boot!
review.name: Confidence inspiring boot with awesome walk mode

review.itemreviewed: Radical Pro Alpine Touring Boot - 2025 - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots performed well on back to back 7 hour long tours. My feet stayed warm and comfortable throughout the day without sacrificing performance on the downhill!
review.name: Comfortable and great control!

review.itemreviewed: Radical Pro Alpine Touring Boot - 2025 - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I come from a freeride and freestyle background in skiing and have always prioritized downhill performance in choosing a ski touring boot. I used to ski on the Hoji Pro Tour W boot, but prefer this boot since it has a toe lug and the fit and flex feels better. Skiing on the Radical Pro W boot has not only allowed me to travel great distances efficiently and complete many ski mountaineering objectives, but it has also allowed me to trust my ability to ski hard downhill with performance similar to what I would have on my resort setup.
I have a wider foot last at the toe box area, but a narrow heel and longer calf muscle. I typically buy 99mm last boots and punch them just below my pinky toe area. This boot fits my foot perfect out of the box and does not hurt my "6th toe" area because of the wider forefoot last, but my heel also stays put and does not move when I walk in the boot. The stiffness of the boot is quite stiff, probably similar to a 120 flex boot, but the flex is progressive and allows you to perform and play in your boot without hitting a wall.
My only dislike of this boot is the quality of the liner. It is fine and lightweight, but shows a lot of wear and tear from rubbing on the inside of the shell, and eventually it starts to rip in areas and fold/create hot spots. I've warrantied the liners in the past but would love to see more durable liner material so they last longer especially in the main areas of motion that are obvious wear places.
Overall, this is my perfect ski touring boot! Please keep making it and in smaller sizes too so my tiny footed female friends can also enjoy it.
I am an average sized foot and I use one of the smallest size boots available...there are many women with much smaller feet than me!
I am a size 7.5 US women's street shoe, 38 Euro, and I ski in a 23.5 Dynafit Radical Pro W boot.
review.name: Best performance boot for female freeriders.

name: Radical Pro Alpine Touring Boot - 2025 - Women's

review.reviewBody: They sent me wrong item. Told me the shorts I ordered were out of stock. Refused to refund until I repackaged their incorrect item and returned it. Terrible customer service.
review.name: Terrible Service
comment: I’m really sorry we sent the incorrect item. I’ve reached out via email to see how I can help make this right for you. Your experience matters to us, so please check your inbox for my message.

review.reviewBody: I normally wear a 31" waist.  In these shorts 31" are a bit too tight and 32" are a bit too loose.
review.name: Weird sizing

review.reviewBody: Others mentioned that these run small. I've been buying these shorts in various colors for a number of years. I got used to the sizing and found the size that works for me - I'm normally a 33 waist but 35 fit perfectly. That is, until I tried the plume grey. Size 35 is way too big and this color seems to be sized normally. Unfortunately, I can't even exchange them as I am not located in the US and shipping cost to return them is prohibitive. It's time to find a different brand.
review.name: Sizing is schizoprhenic

review.reviewBody: The fabric is light, and with an I seam of 6 inches fits great on my 5?8? frame. I?m a waist size 32 in Levi?s, but went up a few sizes after reading previous reviews. I ordered both a 34 and 35 and stuck with the 35.
review.name: Runs small

review.reviewBody: You just cannot win with these shorts. I am not sure what measuring scale Patagonia is using to make these, but I have already sent them back twice. Whatever the price listed, add the cost of at least one return plus another week wait for the replacement to arrive to get at the true cost of this purchase.
review.name: Sizes are all wrong

name: Lightweight All-Wear Hemp 6in Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: This jacket has the insulation of a T-Shirt at best.  I have had other hybrid jackets in the past that I loved.  It was often times enough to wear climbing with just a shirt underneath.  Not this one.  The label says peraloft, but the cells have little to zero insulation in them.  Wore it on a walk yesterday in 37 degree weather and was shivering.
review.name: Not warm at all

review.reviewBody: Great jacket... very comfortable fit. Looking forward for skiing and not apres with it
review.name: Perfect Fit

review.reviewBody: Excellent warmth for the weight! Fits close but still allows for some layering. Arms are a good length.
review.name: Just what I was looking for

review.reviewBody:
Warm, breathable, stylish, and comfortable. This is my go-to jacket. I wear it casually and for hiking, spring ski touring, and paragliding. The hybrid sleeves give an easy and quiet range of motion. Fits nicely under a shell when I need more protection. 

I had last year's version but I lost it. My one gripe was the front zipper. I ordered this year's model and they've improved zipper. Not sure what they did, but it works better and feels premium. Very pleased.
review.name: Favorite jacket

name: Lifaloft Hybrid Insulator Jacket - Men's

hasVariant.name: Geode Thermagraph Bib Pant - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the 686 Geode Thermagraph Bib Pant - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I absolutely Love these bibs! I put these through the ringer this season, and they did the job. I am muscularly built and with most bibs I have always had to get mens so I have more freedom of movement. But these are flattering, functional and still give me the room to move, and layer.
review.name: Great Bibs!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I haven't worn it during the winter months yet but upon delivery, I can tell it is really good quality and will keep me nice and warm. It fits a bit long on me because I am a short person but the snowboarding boots will help with the length. There is also space if I want to wear layers underneath. Otherwise, it is a nice bib.
review.name: Nice bib

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I think the fit is very flattering. I just wish they offered the bib in different lengths. I'm 5'2, and the bib runs long, but I'm sure when I wear my boots, they should be fine.
review.name: Very Flattering!

review.reviewBody: They’re cool, lots of pockets, super comfy. I would say to size up.
review.name: Love these bibs!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the fit and the straps are made to not fall down or twist at the connection. Great value for money, wish they were GoreTex but didn’t want the hydration pouch.
review.name: Love the fit and the

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These bibs are awesome! I typically buy north face bibs and these seem like a total upgrade in the fabric quality and fit. I sized up for layering abilities, the legs were a little long but once in boots it doesn’t really matter! Both sides zip down making it easier to get in and out as you do have to lift the straps overhead to get in.
review.name: Great bibs!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I LOVE THESE!!! I cannot wait to wear them snowboarding. They fit very well around the waist - not too tight. So many pockets and a convenient one for my phone. The black color is also a must this season with the winter we are having.
review.name: What an upgrade! Great quality!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super comfy with stretch but had to size down because of the length. I wanted a loose fit but the large is too long and would fit someone that is 5'8 while most females average 5'4 in height. The medium is generously sized and I was able to size down but more fitted.
review.name: A bit too long if you size up

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love that you can unzip both sides, but wish it had thigh vents. Keep in mind that these are really really thick, so if you’re looking for bibs for cold weather these are the ones. If you’re riding in weather where it’s not super cold you’d be pretty hot wearing these with layers. 

I’m giving it 5 stars though because the quality is really good, the fit is true to size. Material is great. Great pockets.
review.name: Good for cold weather

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are long enough for my 33" inseam, have a side zipper for my hips to get situated before we head out into the cold, have great pocket access, and the insulation is perfect for snow blowing, snow sitting, snow socializing and snow skiing. The straps are comfy, stretchy and I still have room to loosen them in case I get taller. Perhaps the only downside between picking a L vs XL in these is that I don't have as much room to layer tops or bottoms under the bibs. 

For reference: I'm 5'9" 185#. My regular pant size is 10 Long (Old Navy) and my shirt size is men's medium. I generally do a lot of snow sitting and playing, so coverage, stretch and length were all important factors for me.
review.name: Great match for my needs

name: Geode Thermagraph Bib Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Admittedly, I haven't put these through the fall test.  I ride XC/Trail and like knee pads for confidence pushing through flat corners.  Pine needles in the fall create very slippery trails.  I've used the Fox Enduro knee pads for the last 2 years.  They're okay and have worked pretty well on falls.  My complaint about them is that the pads are flat (rather than formed) in their natural resting state so they tend to put pressure on your knee cap while pedaling.  I went in search of a better minimalist knee pad and bought both the Rapha Trail Knee Pads ($110) and these POC VPD Air Leg pads.  Both are superior to the Fox Enduros as they're shaped.  Both stay in place well.  I'd like both to have a higher leg cuff (similar to Fox's) as both periodically had the unsightly thigh gap when worn with my Assos Trail Shorts (these are first rate).  Perhaps preference but I find the POC VPD Air Legs fit me like they were designed specifically for me.  The Raphas are a little tight in the calf but a little loose in the thigh. The Rapha sizing seems weird in general.  I'm a L in the Fox Enduros, M in the POC, and oddly, a S in the Raphas.  From an appearance standpoint, the POCs are the best looking of the three.  The POCs are nearly half the price of the Raphas and seem like the H2H winners to me.  

I'll still wear the Raphas as my backup pads but I think the Fox's will be retired.
review.name: Pedal friendly

review.reviewBody: These knee pads are great. You?ll forget you?re wearing them once you start riding. Even when you?re pedaling in hot weather you really don?t feel them. It?s better to be padded and not need it then to not be padded and need it. I highly recommend these. I suggest going with the size measurement that POC recommends.
review.name: Great minimalist knee pad

review.reviewBody: These are great intermediate pads that are light yet functional.
review.name: Fit great

name: VPD Air Leg

hasVariant.name: Phaze 130
hasVariant.description: Buy the DAKINE Phaze 130 online or shop all Wake from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I write this as a warning from a purchaser of this board. DON’T DO IT. 15 days of use and it’s coming apart. This is one of the worst built products I have ever purchased in wind sports. Decking peeling after 3 days, Potato chip thin eps skin, Cracking rails, and horrible deformation on the bottom. My experience with warranty at Adventure Sports Inc (this is who Dakine windsports has branded the product of, so don’t expect Dakine’s usual brand support) has been two months of laughably poor disservice. Unfortunately I am not the one laughing…There are dozens of other boards at this price point, including on this website, that are far superior and actually care about your satisfaction. Do yourself a favor and pick a different board no matter how discounted this one will (almost certainly) become. It’s just not built to last!
review.name: Do not buy this board!

name: Phaze 130

review.reviewBody: These pants are very cute but they are aggressively large. I am confused because it says the model is wearing a 6, i sized down to a 4 and they literally fall off of me. They also kind of pooch out in the crotch area. May try sizing down to a 2 to see if the crotch area is less baggy. I really like them so hopefully the size 2 is a better fit.
review.name: Huge

review.reviewBody: I ordered a size 4 originally and they were massive. The model is wearing a size 6 and I’m a little shorter than her so I thought those would fit me. Returned them and got a size 2. Still a little big. I was hoping they would be a little high waisted. The area folds weird, not because they are big on me but I think that’s just how they are. The butt also does this duck tail thing and it is not flattering. I mens pant would fit and shape better than these. Cool pants but missed the mark on fitting these correctly for women. Maybe it doesn’t fit my body type correctly, as I’m pretty slim.
review.name: Weird fit

name: Duck Carpenter Straight Pant - Women's

description: Buy the LEKI Detect S Ski Poles online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Detect S Ski Poles
hasVariant.description: Buy the LEKI Detect S Ski Poles online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
These are great looking and durable poles. 

Unfortunately the Trigger S system that keeps the straps in place is flawed, and locks up during temps below freezing. This causes the straps to fall off the poles when you don’t expect it (like on the chairlift).

This is a known issue from Leki and I haven’t seen any recommended fixes from them.

I would not buy these until a fix is made.
review.name: Great poles, bad straps

review.reviewBody:
Just what i ordered
Old like replacement after 10 years
review.name: Quality poles

review.reviewBody: Love these poles! Super simple, easy to use, comfortable grip. No nonsense quality!
review.name: Tremendous value and performance

review.reviewBody: These poles are great. Solid construction, well built. Can’t wait to use this season
review.name: A great pole

review.reviewBody: What a great ski pole. The grip has a fantastic feel to it and the swing weight is excellent. The durability is also great.
review.name: Great Ski Pole

review.reviewBody: Love these poles. Really handy to have both sets of baskets and the quick release straps are genius.
review.name: Run don’t walk to buy these poles

name: Detect S Ski Poles

description: Buy the Shimano PD-T8000 XT Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: PD-T8000 XT Pedals
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano PD-T8000 XT Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought a pair of these pedals about 3 weeks ago for my CANYON cf sl gravel bike, and I simply love the feeling of these pedals, nice grip on both sides. Love them so much that I’ve placed an order for another pair for my PINARELLO “ crossista” cyclocross bike. Definitely a happy camper here🤘🏼
review.name: Awesome feel!

review.reviewBody:
I have been riding flats my whole life and recently decided to give clips a go. Rather than going "all in," I bought these knowing that I could ride flats on one side and clips on the other! It does the trick and gives me a lot of options.

Only thing I would suggest is changing out the pins with some a bit longer as these don't have nearly enough bite in em to compare with other flat pedals.

Great buy all in all!
review.name: Gives you options!

name: PD-T8000 XT Pedals
